DOMSource().Description: Zero-argument default constructor. If this constructor is used, and no DOM source is set using @B_javax#xml#transform#dom#DOMSource#setNode_E@ , then the Transformer will create an empty source @B_org#w3c#dom#Document_E@ using @B_javax#xml#parsers#DocumentBuilder#newDocument_E@.

Returns: The node that is to be transformed.
getNode().Description: Get the node that represents a Source DOM tree.

Parameters: String: Base URL for this DOM tree.
setSystemId(java.lang.String).Description: Set the base ID (URL or system ID) from where URLs will be resolved.

Parameters: Node: The DOM node that will contain the Source tree.
DOMSource(org.w3c.dom.Node).Description: Create a new input source with a DOM node. The operation will be applied to the subtree rooted at this node. In XSLT, a "/" pattern still means the root of the tree (not the subtree), and the evaluation of global variables and parameters is done from the root node also.

Parameters: Node: The node that is to be transformed.
setNode(org.w3c.dom.Node).Description: Set the node that will represents a Source DOM tree.

Parameters: Node: The DOM node that will contain the Source tree.
String: Specifies the base URI associated with node.
DOMSource(org.w3c.dom.Node, java.lang.St.Description: Create a new input source with a DOM node, and with the system ID also passed in as the base URI.

ClassDesc: Acts as a holder for a transformation Source tree in the form of a Document Object Model (DOM) tree. Note that XSLT requires namespace support. Attempting to transform a DOM that was not contructed with a namespace-aware parser may result in errors. Parsers can be made namespace aware by calling @B_javax#xml#parsers#DocumentBuilderFactory#setNamespaceAware_E@.
